results.title: For science and the arts
results.brief_description: A rare distinction for outstanding achievements in science or art is selection to the exclusive German Order “Pour le Merite”, limited to 30 German and 30 foreign artists and scientists. Shows distinguished members and outstanding scientific and artistic achievements of the 19th and 20th centuries. In English and German language.

results.title: For peace of mind
results.creator_credit: Fiona Banks, Hilary Christmas, Film Victoria, Tanglefoot Productions and Australia. Dept. of Health, Housing and Community Services
results.brief_description: A creative video set in rural Victoria, which revolves around two friends, Maureen and Fay, and Maureen’s daughter Di. The program targets women over 50, promotes the benefits of having a Pap Smear on a regular basis and deals with the barriers women face to having them. The storyline is interwoven with professional opinions from experts and practitioners in women’s health, and reveals commonly held attitudes to the subject by women in this age group.

results.title: For my true love
results.creator_credit: Russell Varney, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Russell and Wendy were both diagnosed with HIV they resolved to lean on each other as they feared discrimination. Eventually they reached out to organisations like Straight Arrows and started to feel alive again.

results.title: For me and my gal
results.creator_credit: Busby Berkeley, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Two of MGM’s brightest stars, Gene Kelly in his film debuty and Judy Garland, teamed in this Busby Berkeley musical about a vaudeville song-and-dance duo who buck tough times and World War I on the way to showbusiness success. The film has a collection of nostalgic gems including “Smiles”, “Ballin’ the Jack” and the title tune. Kelly’s inimitable dance style shines and Garland sustains her position as one of the greatest Hollywood legends. Bursting with energy, this is an old-fashioned musical for everyone who loves the movies.

results.title: For love or money: a history of women and work in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jeni Thornley, Margot Oliver, Margot Nash, Megan McMurchy and Flashback Films
results.brief_description: Tells the story of women’s working lives throughout Australia’s history. Juxtaposes clips from feature films, home movies, newsreels and documentaries with radio shows, diaries, popular songs, letters and interviews. Explores the challenges that face women in the nuclear age. Narrated by Noni Hazlehurst; edited by Margot Nash; music by Elizabeth Drake.
results.title_for_label: For love or money: a history of women and work in Australia
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeni Thornley, Margot Oliver, Margot Nash, Megan McMurchy and Flashback Films

results.title: For love or money
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
One of a series of films about attitudes to work. Deals with the satisfaction one feels when working for yourself, doing something you really enjoy, even if the money is not as much as working for an employer. A commercial artist, sign-writer and a mechanic present their viewpoints.

results.title: For love of gold
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: Based on a Jack London story about two burglars, each poisoning the other for the loot. Cast includes Harry Solter, George Gebhardt, Charles Gorman, Charles Inslee. Silent film with English intertitles.
